RAB retainability.description: This KPI measures the impact on the end user. Its purpose is to                                     reflect the probability of an established E-RAB becoming lost                                     with an abnormal release.  The MIMO Sleep Mode feature offers the option to perform a                                         SOFT SWITCH, which internally performs a                                     cell shutdown before cell reconfiguration from MIMO to SIMO, or

This KPI measures the impact on....description: This KPI measures the impact on the end users.  If ADVANCED_SWITCH mode is used with the                                         MimoSleepFunction​.rank2Enabled attribute                                     set to true, this KPI might increase in good                                     coverage and high traffic scenarios.

cell.description: The Prescheduling feature leads to a greater scheduling activity,                                     which can be interpreted as a decrease of the UL MAC cell                                     throughput in less-loaded cells.

uplink.description: Minor impact, RRC signalling has scheduling priority over user                                     data  Minor impact, measurement gaps can decrease uplink                                     throughput.

downlink.description: Minor impact, measurement gaps can decrease downlink                                     throughput.

This KPI might improve in high....description: This KPI might improve in high uplink traffic load cells.

node retainability.description: When the Service Specific Inactivity timer feature is activated,                                     the node retainability rate can decrease.

accessibility success rate.description: When the Inter-Frequency Offload feature is activated, the                                     accessibility success rate can slightly decrease for end-user                                     services carried by E-RABs included in the E-RAB setup                                     procedure.

downlink throughput.description: Measurable downlink throughput gain is expected with this feature in TM3 and TM4                   compared to 2TX TM3.  It is preferable to measure the PM counters in networks with high traffic                   activity, and compare calculated downlink UE throughput to the performance                   achieved by 2TX TM3 under the same conditions.  Negative impact on the KPIs is not expected where there is no relation to                   downlink throughput.  In TM9, the downlink peak rate i

This performance indicator monitors the.description: This performance indicator monitors the queue bandwidth ratio to                                     physical link interface.

Mobility Success Rate.description: The Mobility Success Rate KPI includes both the preparation of                                     the target cell resources and the move from the source cell to                                     the target cell. Performance of Carrier Aggregation-Aware IFLB                                     improves this KPI.

and retainability.description: The feature improves accessibility and retainability during overload                             situations.

This KPI value might indicate whether....description: This KPI value might indicate whether the different offset values                                     for handover or measurement are good enough.

DL MAC throughput.description: Normalized DL MAC throughput against traffic. Slots where no                                 traffic is taking place are excluded.

The KPI is normalized for the....description: The KPI is normalized for the TDD pattern so that only time                                 available in the downlink is included.

Describes the probability of not detecti.description: Describes the probability of not detecting a sent                                         Acknowledgement (ACK).

Describes the probability of detecting a.description: Describes the probability of detecting an ACK when a Negative                                         Acknowledgement (NACK) is sent.

DRB throughput.description: Downlink DRB throughput might increase because of the higher data                                     rates from carrier aggregation-capable UEs.(1)

Performance gain can be observed in....description: Performance gain can be observed in single- and multi-layer                                         transmissions compared to when EIRP is reduced.

The KPI is increased if the....description: The KPI is increased if the feature is enabled and UEs access a                                     cell operating in a frequency range of the extended n77                                     band.

The KPI can decrease if the....description: The KPI can decrease if the extended n77 band is deployed and the                                     feature is not enabled on all nodes.

The KPI can decrease if UEs....description: The KPI can decrease if UEs without the extended n77 capability                                     request access to a cell operating in a frequency range of the                                     extended n77 band.

This KPI is decreased by this feature..description: This KPI is decreased by this feature.

lower throughput.description: This KPI is expected to decrease due to SCell deactivation,                                     when multiple UEs experience overheating condition. Network                                     connection is retained at a stable lower throughput.

The feature improves the RACH success ra.description: The feature improves the RACH success rate.

improves retainability.description: The feature improves retainability in EN-DC deployments.

These KPIs might be degraded when....description: These KPIs might be degraded when using this feature.

For sustained traffic, this KPI shows....description: For sustained traffic, this KPI shows an increase because of the                                     increased amount of data in uplink transmission.  For traffic occurring in bursts, the KPI might show an increase                                     because of the increased amount of data and the decreased time                                     for PUSCH scheduling.

UE throughput.description: Measures Uplink MAC UE throughput impact on end user.

Accessibility success rate.description: Describes the number of attempted connection establishments.                                     Accessibility success rates for end-user services that are                                     carried by DRBs.

Percentage of established DRBs that are..description: Percentage of established DRBs that are abnormally released,                                     initiated by gNodeB or Access and Mobility Management Function                                     (AMF).

normalized throughput.description: Measures normalized throughput against traffic. Slots with no                                     traffic are excluded.

This KPI is normalized for TDD....description: This KPI is normalized for TDD patterns, therefore, it only                                     includes time that is available for downlink.

Measures node support for the characteri.description: Measures node support for the characteristic values of paging                                     overload.

Measures the ratio between the number....description: Measures the ratio between the number of discarded paging                                     messages and the number of received paging messages.

Measures the service request time when...description: Measures the service request time when the UE is in RRC_IDLE mode                                     and the                                     round-trip                                     time when the UE is in RRC_CONNECTED mode.

Measures the number of paging messages...description: Measures the number of paging messages per second in gNodeB.

Describes how often a random access....description: Describes how often a random access Msg3 is received after a                                     random access Msg2 transmission.

Measures the success rate of UE context.description: Measures the success rate of UE context setups.

If 1% BLER target is configured,....description: If 1% BLER target is configured, the KPI can decrease.

SRS resource utilization might change if.description: SRS resource utilization might change if PUSCH P0 nominal value                                     is auto-selected based on the                                         NRCellDU.pZeroNomPuschGrant                                     attribute.  With a varying P0 value, uplink interference might increase,                                     which can degrade SRS SINR.

uplink cell.description: After enabling the Closed-Loop Power Control feature, uplink cell                                 throughput might increase.

If the feature is activated, the....description: If the feature is activated, the uplink packet loss rate might                                     increase if the integrity verification fails.

The feature is expected to improve the K.description: The feature is expected to improve the KPI.

In poor radio conditions, the feature....description: In poor radio conditions, the feature enables configuration                                     possibilities to improve these KPIs associated with the targeted                                     service.

the.description: For traffic which uses small SDU (for example, VoLTE), the                                     throughput is not a good measurement to evaluate performance.                                     This is because most of the traffic uses a single TTI and are                                     excluded from the PM counters.

An increase is expected if the....description: An increase is expected if the downlink carrier aggregation is                                     not used in legacy.

LBT success rate.description: An increase is expected if the downlink carrier aggregation is                                     not used in legacy. Not always corresponding to transmitted                                     data. Data can be scheduled but not transmitted if there is no                                     LBT success rate.

The Low Energy Scheduler Solution featur.description: The Low Energy Scheduler Solution feature delays data, which                                     increases data queueing time. As a result, KPIs based on data                                     queueing time can                                     decrease.

uplink cell throughput.description: After enabling the Differential Uplink Power Control feature,                                     uplink cell throughput can be increased. The gain is expected                                     when the cell experiences high external uplink wideband                                     interference, especially higher than P0. If lots of connected                                     users are power limited, then no gain is expected.

This KPI improves as a result....description: This KPI improves as a result of power control optimization.

Increased for the data-aware UEs. No....description: The KPI is impacted only when the Data-Aware Uplink Scheduling feature is enabled and the following conditions are met: At least one large-buffer UE is in good channel conditions in the cell. Cell loa

If the pmHoPrepAttLteIntraF counter incr.description: If the pmHoPrepAttLteIntraF counter increases                                     significantly after the activation of the feature, the mobility                                     parameters must be checked, because they might need additional                                     adjustment.

downlink cell.description: The recommended throughput metric is downlink cell                                     throughput.

The feature applies a specific DRX....description: The feature applies a specific DRX pattern with a 40 ms long                                     cycle. Depending on the configured DRX settings, the downlink                                     latency can increase or decrease according to the following:    If the configured DRX pattern is larger than 40 ms, the                                             downlink latency is improved.     If the configured DRX pattern is smaller than 40 ms, or                                             DRX is

Data volume transmitted in a given time.description: Data volume transmitted in a given time unit

Accessibility KPIs.description: The GBR load is higher than the partition can handle when GBR traffic is partitioned.

to throughput.description: Lower capacity can lead to throughput degradation.

Latency KPIs.description: The share of resources assigned to a partition cannot serve the number of UEs or the traffic generated by UEs in the partition.

For more information on the KPI,....description: For more information on the KPI, see Key Performance                                         Indicators.

The QoS-Aware Scheduler feature allows t.description: The QoS-Aware Scheduler feature allows the configuration of the                                     scheduler on a QCI basis, and enables the configuration of                                     scheduling algorithms for each QCI. Because of that, a decrease                                     in metrics is expected.

These indicators might increase, if the..description: These indicators might increase, if the channel quality                                     compensation for scheduling function of the QoS-Aware Scheduler                                     feature is enabled. By enabling this function, the scheduling is                                     improved, as the eNodeB performs scheduling weight compensation                                     based on the GINR and the rank of each UE.

The Dynamic GBR Admission Control featur.description: The Dynamic GBR Admission Control feature introduces a                                     configurable GBR threshold and several checkpoints, regarding                                     the admittance of GBR requests. Because of that, the operator                                     can expect a decrease in metrics.

The SubscriberGroupProfile.sCellSchedule.description: Might decrease in low load Might increase in high load(1)

Cell Throughput.description: The SubscriberGroupProfile.sCellScheduleSinrThresOffset attribute is configured to a negative value.

users Throughput.description: When the LTE AI Powered MIMO Sleep Mode feature forces smaller                                     MIMO or SIMO configuration in a cell, negative impact can be                                     observed for the following metrics:  Coverage for low SINR users     Throughput for low SINR users     Peak throughput for high SINR users

When the LTE AI Powered MIMO....description: When the LTE AI Powered MIMO Sleep Mode feature uses TM4 rank 2                                     in MI_SWITCH mode, this KPI might decrease.

Accessibility is increased for UEs and...description: Accessibility is increased for UEs and E-RABs with high ARP                                     priority.  Because of this, an increase in metrics is                                 expected.

When pre-emption is activated, retainabi.description: When pre-emption is activated, retainability is decreased for UEs                                     and E-RABs with low ARP priority. Because of this, a decrease in                                     metrics is expected.

This feature might affect the number....description: This feature might affect the number of handovers, which might                                     affect this mobility KPI.

This KPI is expected to decrease....description: This KPI is expected to decrease on the network level. The                                     downlink-triggered VoLTE mobility procedure is performed to                                     avoid service quality loss caused by the fast degradation of                                     downlink radio conditions.

This KPI is expected to increase....description: This KPI is expected to increase for voice on the network                                     level.

The ability of a service to....description: The ability of a service to be obtained, within specified tolerances and other                   given conditions, when requested by the end user.

The ability of the system to allow movem.description: The ability of the system to allow movement.

cell throughput.description: This KPI is expected to increase, because better cell throughput                                     is expected in high load conditions. The increase is possible as                                     PDCCH exhaustion affects downlink and uplink payload volume                                     less.

These KPIs are expected to decrease....description: These KPIs are expected to decrease on the network level. The                                     uplink-triggered VoLTE mobility procedure is performed to avoid                                     service quality loss caused by the fast degradation of uplink                                     radio conditions.

uplink throughput.description: This feature reduces uplink throughput, since uplink subframe is                                     shifted to downlink subframe.

These indicators might increase when the.description: These indicators might increase when the use of PRBs are limited                                     as a result of congestion.

This indicator might decrease when the...description: This indicator might decrease when the use of PRBs are limited as                                     a result of congestion.

When the Dynamic UE Admission Control....description: When the Dynamic UE Admission Control feature and the Optimized                                     PDCCH feature are activated together, this indicator is expected                                     to increase during PDCCH congestion.

This KPI might improve when the....description: This KPI might improve when the LTE Flexible Power Boost for                                     Initial Access feature is enabled.

These are new KPIs for the....description: These are new KPIs for the newly introduced QCIs, based on                                     existing VoLTE KPIs.

These KPIs are also applicable for....description: These KPIs are also applicable for the newly introduced QCIs.

The new value, EVENT_VALUE_MO_VOICE, is.description: The new value, EVENT_VALUE_MO_VOICE, is added to                                     event parameter EVENT_PARAM_RRC_ESTABL_CAUSE

Increased. The effect is subtle, because.description: Increased. The effect is subtle, because                                         EranUlComp is only triggered for cell                                     edge users and only for a limited number of Coordinated                                     Multi-Point PRBs.

Retainability is improved by UEs that....description: Retainability                                     is improved by UEs that are not selected to collect data for                                     this feature, as they spend less time in poor coverage. This                                     lowers the risk for radio link failure and                                     drop.

Average UL Packet Loss Rate per....description: Average UL Packet Loss Rate per QCI is expected to be decreased,                                     and VoIP Integrity is expected to be increased, because if UEs                                     in poor coverage accept the recommended bit rate, lower codec                                     rate is used for the VoLTE calls. Lower bit rate results in                                     smaller packets, that have higher chance to be delivered                                     successfully.

The feature improves accessibility. The.description: The feature improves accessibility. The Admission-Triggered                                     Offload feature offloads UEs to other frequencies or RATs                                     efficiently because it considers PTT MSR reservations.

The KPI is increased in interference....description: The KPI is increased in interference limited scenarios.

the throughput.description: The feature increases the throughput gain of carrier                                     aggregation.

These KPIs are used to measure....description: These KPIs are used to measure uplink compression efficiency.  To measure the efficiency of Uplink Robust Header Compression for                                     Data only the data related to default QCIs 9, 8, 6 and the                                     Mission Critical Push to Talk related QCI 70 needs to be                                     collected.

The throughput.description: The throughput of the cells selected as high baseband                                         priority is stable regardless of the load in cells with                                         normal baseband priority (assuming different carriers for                                         the normal priority cells).

QCI loss rate decreases when the....description: QCI loss rate decreases when the Coverage-Triggered Mobility at                                     Setup feature is activated.

The benefit of the feature can....description: The benefit of the feature can be observed as Average DL UE                                     Latency KPI decreases.

In the uplink interference improved scen.description: In the uplink interference improved scenario, this KPI can be                                     improved as voice packets are scheduled in low interfered                                     PRBs.

These KPIs can degrade because uplink....description: These KPIs can degrade because uplink available spectrum becomes                                     more fragmented or new transmission gets less PDCCH resource in                                     high PDCCH resource use case. This impact depends on the traffic                                     load and traffic types in the cell.

After an uplink-heavy handover, PRB use..description: After an uplink-heavy handover, PRB use decreases in the source                                     cell and increases in the target cell.

demodulation success rate.description: Improves. The demodulation success rate of PUSCH improves,                                     because the uplink interference is suppressed.

Increases. The downlink is affected by...description: Increases. The downlink is affected by the switching from SSP6 or                                     SSP7 to SSP5.

Decreases. The downlink is affected by...description: Decreases. The downlink is affected by the switching from SSP6 or                                     SSP7 to SSP5.

Increases. The downlink retransmission i.description: Increases. The downlink retransmission in special subframes is                                     affected by the switching from SSP6 or SSP7 to SSP5.

Increases. The PDCCH Usage is affected...description: Increases. The PDCCH Usage is affected by the switching from SSP6                                     or SSP7 to SSP5.

Values for this KPI are reduced,....description: Values for this KPI are reduced, because when IDC for Uplink                                     Carrier Aggregation is indicated and disables uplink grants on                                     one or several carriers for the affected UE, then its uplink                                     capacity is reduced.

Values for this KPI can be....description: Values for this KPI can be reduced because of secondary impact                                     from the cell not being able to fully use all uplink                                     resources.

The KPI is increased in cells....description: The KPI is increased in cells with large multipath delay                                     difference between 5.5 µs and 11 µs.

UL t.description: PUCCH needs more radio resources at the expense of PUSCH. UL                                     throughput decreases in the entire cell.

DL throughput.description: DL throughput decreases because of scheduling limitation in the                                     entire cell when there are UEs in different zones.

If there are UEs in outer....description: If there are UEs in outer zones, latency increases in general                                     because of zone handling in the scheduler. In outer zones, the                                     latency is even higher, because there is higher pathloss and a                                     larger amount of retransmissions and HARQ failures.  VoLTE related KPIs are affected by increased latency.

Degrades because of more retransmissions.description: Degrades because of more retransmissions and more HARQ                                     failures.

The DL Transport Ratio will show....description: The DL Transport Ratio will show higher ratios for lower                                     modulation order with UEs in zone 1 and zone 2.

Peak throughput.description: Peak throughput achieved by a single UE can be lowered, as the                                     available spectrum becomes more fragmented and the largest                                     possible island allocation size is reduced. The magnitude of                                     this impact depends on the exact load and type of traffic in the                                     cell.

Impacts users that do not find....description: Impacts users that do not find any other component carrier and                                     cannot configure special cell because of high load.

If thresholds for this feature are....description: If thresholds for this feature are set improperly then CA                                     blocking mechanism can reduce utilization of cell resources.

Percentage of established NR connections.description: Percentage of established NR connections lost with abnormal                                     release for UEs in NR-DC or NR standalone deployments.  This KPI might decrease if the High Power UE Support in NR                                     function is enabled.

Percentage of established NR connections for UEs in NR-DC or NR                                     standalone deployments that are lost with abnormal release,                                     initiated by gNodeB only.  This KPI might decrease if the High Power UE Support in NR                                     function is enabled.

Uplink packet loss is monitored for....description: Uplink packet loss is monitored for both NR SA and EN-DC UEs.

Access Success Rate.description: Describes the frequency of detecting a PUSCH, which is initially                                     scheduled by an uplink grant in the random access Msg2                                     message.  If CFRA is enabled in the cell, this KPI might increase compared                                     to the Random Access Success Rate Captured in gNodeB KPI in                                     similar radio conditions.  This KPI might increase if the High Power UE Support in NR

the success rate.description: Measures the success rate of UE context setups.  This KPI might increase if the High Power UE Support in NR                                     function is enabled.

Measures cell handover performance in NR.description: Measures cell handover performance in NR standalone in source                                     gNodeB.  This KPI might increase if the High Power UE Support in NR                                     function is enabled.

downlink MAC throughput.description: Normalized downlink MAC throughput against traffic. Slots where                                 no traffic is taking place are excluded.

and success rate.description: This KPI can improve due to higher handover and success rate from                                     NR to LTE toward newly added neighbor cells.

Throughput achieved by total downlink MA.description: Throughput achieved by total downlink MAC volume during a                                     complete measurement period (ROP).

RACH success.description: The improved PRACH detection might improve the RACH success                                     rate.

Setup.description: The improved PRACH detection might improve the EN-DC Setup                                     success rate.

the retainability.description: In high-speed areas, the feature might improve the retainability                                     of SCG radio resources.

Change success rate.description: The improved PRACH detection might improve the EN-DC Intra-gNodeB PSCell Change success rate.

The feature enables the correct pegging..description: The feature enables the correct pegging of these KPIs. This means                                     that different QCIs and 5QIs end up in different bins.

downlink cell throughput.description: If this feature is enabled, the downlink cell throughput for                                     cells with stationary or slowly moving SRS-capable UEs in good                                     or medium channel conditions is expected to increase.

DL Volume per Cell.description: If the traffic load is low when the feature is deactivated, this KPI might be increased when the feature is activated, because more cell-edge UEs can attach with traffic. If the traffic load is very h

The KPI might be higher as....description: The KPI might be higher as uplink data transmission increases                                     because of the improved cell utilization. The KPI might also be                                     higher if the NRCellDU.puschModeOnFddSCell                                     attribute is set to a value other than LONG,                                     because more slots are available on the Low-Band carrier for                                     PUSCH data scheduling.

aggregation throughput.description: The KPI might be higher because the uplink carrier aggregation                                     provides a larger pipe. As a result, more transmissions end up                                     as unrestricted volume in the last slot or in a single slot                                     volume. The KPI might also be higher if the                                         NRCellDU.puschModeOnFddSCell attribute is                                     set to a value other than LONG, because more

Requests to establish further PDU sessio.description: Requests to establish further PDU sessions or QoS flows are                                     rejected after reaching the configured limits, which degrades                                     the KPI when the feature protects ongoing traffic.

The KPI might degradebecause of the....description: The KPI might                                     degradebecause                                     of the increased data volume scheduled for transmission

This KPI might increase, except when....description: This KPI might increase, except when cell load and resource                                     contention is low.

Enabling the preemption function of this.description: Enabling the preemption function of this feature degrades the KPI                                     for QoS flows with low ARP.

Activating the NR Soft Admission feature.description: Activating the NR Soft Admission feature might degrade this                                     KPI.
